sentences.en: This book can be used either in the classroom or for independent study.
sentences.zh: 本书可用于课堂教学，也可用于自学。

userTranslationZh.text: 这本书可以被用于课堂教学或者自学。其主要是为中文翻译者或者正在练习翻译的英语专业高年级学生而写。但我也希望这本书同样对那些需要英语写作并且期待提升写作能力的中国人有帮助，比如新闻，外交，商务，旅游，广告和其他众多行业的从业人员。

userTranslationEn.text: This book can be used for teaching or self-learning. Its main audience is Chinese translatiors and senior student of English practicing translation. I hope, however, this guide can be helpful to other Chinese who need to write in English, those include, journalism, affair worker,  people who are involved in business, tourism, advertisment and other lines of work that needs English writting, also who wish to better master English

history.text: Naturally, readers who open this book will have reached varying levels of skill in their second language. But to one degree or another, the work of all but the most highly trained and experienced among them will inevitably contain elements of Chinglish. Chinglish, of course, is that misshapen, hybrid language that s neither English nor Chinese but that might be described as" English with Chinese characteristics."

sentences.en: It is addressed primarily to Chinese translators and to advanced students of English who are practicing translation.
sentences.zh: 其主要对象是中国的翻译工作者以及做翻译练习的高年级英语学生。

sentences.en: I hope, however, that it will prove equally useful to other Chinese who are called upon to write English and who wish to improve their mastery of it -people working in journalism, foreign affairs, business, tourism, advertising, and many other fields.
sentences.zh: 但是，我希望这本书对需要用英语写作的其他中国人 (包括新闻工作者、外事工作者、从事商业、旅游业、广告业以及许多其他行业需要使用英语的工作者) 同样有帮助，而他们又都希望解够更好地掌握英语。

sentences.en: Naturally, readers who open this book will have reached varying levels of skill in their second language.
sentences.zh: 自然，当读者翻阅这本书时，他们使用第二语言的技能所达到的水平是不同的。

userTranslationZh.text: 自然，翻阅这本书的读者，他们的第二语言的水平是不同的。但除了那些受过高强度训练或者有着丰富经验的人之外，他们的翻译中都有着或多或少的中式英语。当然，中式英语是一种畸形的，混合的语言，既不是英文也不是中文，而更像是一种具有中文特色的英文。

history.text: 自然而然的，打开这本书的读者都在他们的第二语言中达到了一定的水平。但即便是他们其中的那些受过高强度训练或者有着丰富经验的人依旧在翻译中有着或多或少的中式英语。中式英语既不是英文也不是中文，而更像是一种具有中文特色的英文，一种混合语言。
自然，打开这本书的读者都在他们的第二语言中达到了一定的水平。但即便是他们其中的那些受过高强度训练或者有着丰富经验的人依旧在翻译中有着或多或少的中式英语。中式英语既不是英文也不是中文，而更像是一种具有中文特色的英文，一种混合语言。

sentences.en: But to one degree or another, the work of all but the most highly trained and experienced among them will inevitably contain elements of Chinglish.
sentences.zh: 但是，除了那些造诣很深的，一般人的翻译中都会不同程度地含有中式英语的成分。

sentences.en: Chinglish, of course, is that misshapen, hybrid language that s neither English nor Chinese but that might be described as" English with Chinese characteristics.
sentences.zh: 当然，所谓中式英语就是那种畸形的，混合的、既非英语又非汉语的语言文字，也可称其为"具有汉语特色的英语"。

sentences.en: In writing this Guide, I have assumed that my Chinese readers have a basic knowledge of English grammar and that if they want a review of the subject, they can find it in other books.
sentences.zh: 在写这本书的过程中，我心目中的中国读者已经掌握了基本的英语语法；如果有人想复习一下他们的语法，可以去求助于有关这方面的书籍。

userTranslationZh.text: 在写这本指导的时候，我假设这本书的中文读者已经具备了基础的英语语法知识，如果想再次对复习这些知识的话，可以参考其他相关书籍。我的写作目的是向那些翻译工作者，包括其他直接用英语写作的读者，展示如何识别他们初稿中的中式英语以及如何修改来去除中式英语。换句话说，这本书是为了帮助读者将他们的作品变成真正的英语，就像一位受过教育的母语工作者所写的一样。

sentences.en: My purpose is rather to show translators -and, by extension, others who are writing directly in English-how to recognize elements of Chinglish in a first draft and how to revise it so as to eliminate those elements.
sentences.zh: 而我的目的则在于帮助翻译工作者以及其他直接用英语写作的人懂得如何在初稿中找出中式英语的成分并将其修改掉。

sentences.en: In other words, this book is intended to help them turn their work into real English such as might have been written by an educated native speaker of the language.
sentences.zh: 也就是说，这本书是为了帮助他们将自己的写作修改成为地道的英语，就像一个受过教育的以英语为母语的人写的一样。

sentences.en: At institutions like Xinhua News Agency, China Daily,Foreign Languages Press, and the Central Translation Bureau, this task is commonly entrusted to senior translators or editors or to foreign "polishers" (who may be more or less competent to perform it).
sentences.zh: 在一些像新华社、《中国日报》社、外文出版社、中央编译局的单位里，这项工作一般是由高级翻译、审校或外国专家做的 (他们或多或少能够胜任这项任务)。

userTranslationZh.text: 在新华社，中国日报，外文出版社以及中央翻译局这些单位中，翻译这项任务通常会被交给高级翻译工作者或者是高级编辑，也可能是那些外国润色工作者，这类人或多或少都有能力来处理这个任务。但实际上，原翻译者或者说写手自己可以完成这些中的大部分工作。这也是为什么在这本书中我有时候称呼他们为翻译工作者，有时候为润色工作者，或是修订者，这些词之前并不互相冲突，每位译者在审阅自己初稿时都可以并且应该是他自己的润色者。

sentences.en: But in principle, much of the work could be done by the original translators 一 or writers -themselves.
sentences.zh: 但是，原则上，大部分工作可由译者 (或作者) 自己来完成。

sentences.en: That s why throughout these pages I have sometimes referred to the "translator," sometimes to the "polisher" or "reviser.
sentences.zh: 为此，在整部书中，我有时用"译者", 有时用"润色者"或"改稿人"。

sentences.en: " The terms are not mutually exclusive: every translator rereading a first draft can and should be his or her own polisher.
sentences.zh: 这些词并不相互排斥：每位译者在审阅其初稿时都可以而且应当是他自己的润色者。

sentences.en: The examples of Chinglish presented here (the "A-version" in each case) are authentic.
sentences.zh: 书中所提供的中式英语的例句 (每一条初译文：A-version) 都是有根据的。

userTranslationZh.text: 这里的中式英语例子，也就是案例中的A版本，都是真实的。也就是说，尽管出于教学目的，其中的一些进行了简化，但无一是凭空捏造的。大多数例子都来源于翻译初稿中，并且在刊登之前都经过了修正，其中的一些取自发表刊物，比如官方文件、中国日报，以及一些其他的英文杂志。只有来自于外国刊物的例子才会被标明出处，比如遥远西方，经济学达人又或者是美国报纸。

sentences.en: That is, although some of them have been simplified for instructional purposes, none are invented.
sentences.zh: 虽然其中有的例句为了便于说明而简化了，但都不是编造出来的。

sentences.en: Most were found in draft translations that were corrected before the text appeared in print.
sentences.zh: 绝大部分例句是从初译稿中搜集的，出书之前都作了修正。

sentences.en: Some were found in published materials -official documents, China Daily, the several English-language magazines, and so on.
sentences.zh: 有些是从出版物中找到的，如：正式文件、《中国日报》、几种英语杂志等等。

sentences.en: The source of an example is indicated only when it appeared in a foreign publication, such as the Far Eastern Economic Review or a U.
sentences.zh: 给出处的例句都是引自外国出版物，如：《远东经济评论》或某份美国报纸。

sentences.en: S.
newspaper.
When an example of Chinglish is taken from a draft translation, the revision offered here (the "B-version") is, with few exceptions, the one decided upon by the polishers who revised it.
sentences.zh: 书中凡是为从初译稿里引用的例句提供的修改译文 (B version), 除个别例外，都是由改稿人定的。

userTranslationZh.text: 对于某个取自初译稿的中式英语例句，除了极少数情况，本书提供的改进意见（也就是B版本）来自于审核该例句的润色者。但是，如果 A 版本出现在发表刊物中，我就会给出我认为应该做出的改进。不论是哪种情况，所提供的B版本都不一定是唯一正确的版本。相比于科学，翻译更像是一门手艺，任何领域的手艺人都有着其就某一技术问题最佳方案的独特观点。

sentences.en: If, however, the A-version appeared in print, the revision is one that I think should have been made and that I am suggesting now.
sentences.zh: 但是，如果 A-version 是从已出版的书中引用的，那么所提供的修改译文则是我认为当初应该改而未改、现在建议这样改的。

sentences.en: In either case, the proposed B-version is not necessarily the only "correct" one.
sentences.zh: 无论是哪一种情况，这里所提供的修改译文不一定是惟一"正确"的。

sentences.en: Translation is not a science but a craft, and craftsmen in any field may have different opinions as to the best solution to a given technical problem.
sentences.zh: 翻译不是一门科学，而是一种需要特殊技能的专业，每个行业的技术工人对于解决某个技术问题的最佳办法都会有不同的见解。

sentences.en: It may seem presumptuous for a person who knows little of the Chinese language to proffer a work of this kind.
sentences.zh: 对于一个不懂汉语的人来说，向读者提供这样一部作品似乎有些不自量力。

userTranslationZh.text: 似乎由一位对中文知之甚少的人来写这种类型的书有点考虑欠佳了。但我的信心和资质来自我对翻译的大量思考。此外，在1980到1990期间，我曾以改稿人的身份在北京工作了8年，首先是在外研社，其次是在中央编译局（专门对马克思、恩格斯、列宁和斯大林的作品进行编译和翻译的机构）。在那些年里，我有机会和许多中国翻译者进行过密切的合作，从刚出校园的新手译者，到能力卓群的资深教授。我从他们身上学到了很多。

sentences.en: My qualifications are (from French to English) who has given much thought to problems of translation.
sentences.zh: 而我所具备的条件是：我一生都在学习英语而且是一名职业翻译 (法译英), 因此，对翻译问题考虑甚多。

sentences.en: In addition, during the 1980s and 1990s I spent eight years working as a polisher in Beijing, first at Foreign Languages Press and later at the Central Translation Bureau (Bureau for the Compilation and Translation of Works of Marx, Engels, Lenin and Stalin).
sentences.zh: 在80年代到90年代期间，我在北京做了八年的修改译文工作，先是在外文出版社，后来在中央编译局 (马恩列斯著作编译局)。

sentences.en: During those years I had the opportunity to work closely with a wide range of Chinese translators, from beginners fresh out of school to the most capable senior professors.
sentences.zh: 在这些年里，我有机会同许多中国的翻译工作者密切合作，他们中间有刚走出校门的新手，也有水平很高的教授。

sentences.en: I learned much from them all.
sentences.zh: 我从他们那里都学到不少东西。

sentences.en: Even with this background, however, I could not have produced this Guide without the help of two invaluable consultants who have kindly read and reread my manuscript.
sentences.zh: 尽管如此，如果没有两位不可多得的人一遍又一遍地帮我审阅我的手稿，这本书是不可能写出来的。

userTranslationZh.text: 即使有着这些经历作为背景，但如果没有来自两位资深顾问的珍贵帮助，来自他们对我初稿的重复阅读，我也很难完成这本书。第一位是我的好朋友姜桂华，她作为前中央编译局英文处处长，带着专业审稿人那般挑剔的眼光检查书中的每一个例句。第二位是我的丈夫拉里，他作为作家和职业新闻工作者的经验以及长年在中国从事教育和译稿润色的经历，都给了我很大帮助。这两位学识渊博的编辑，且各自的语言都达到了母语水平，给出的建议和批评都非常直接且不可或缺。

sentences.en: The first is my good friend Jiang Guihua, the retired chief of the English section at the Central Translation Bureau, who has examined every example with the critical eye of a skilled reviser.
sentences.zh: 首先是我的好朋友姜桂华，她退休前任中央编译局英文处处长，她以一名有水平的改稿者身份严格地检查了每一个例句。

sentences.en: The second is my husband Larry, who has given me the benefit of his expertise as a writer and as a professor of journalism who has had long experience both teaching and polishing in China.
sentences.zh: 其次是我先生拉里，他是一名作家和新闻学教授，曾多年在中国任教并从事修改译文工作，他的专长使我受益非浅。

sentences.en: The criticism and advice of these two knowledgeable editors, one native speaker of each language, have been, quite simply, indispensable.
sentences.zh: 这两位有知识的审校人，一位的母语是英语，一位的母语是汉语，他们提出的批评和建议很简单，但却是不可或缺的。

sentences.en: The essence of learning is tranquility.
sentences.zh: 学习的本质是平静。

userTranslationZh.text: 学习的本质是平静。学习不是一场竞争，而是一段需要耐心才能走完的旅程。最重要的，学习不是为了能够兴奋。不是一个需要聚集庞大能量或者强制自己行动的过程。正相反，学习应该是一个平稳且从容不迫进步的过程。

sentences.en: Learning is not a race but a journey, one that requires patience.
sentences.zh: 学习不是一场赛跑，而是一段需要耐心的旅程。

sentences.en: At its core, learning is not about excitement.
sentences.zh: 学习的核心不是兴奋。

sentences.en: It's not about mustering overwhelming energy or forcing oneself into action.
sentences.zh: 它并非关于积聚压倒性的能量或强迫自己行动。

sentences.en: Instead, it's about steady, deliberate progress.
sentences.zh: 相反，它关乎稳定、深思熟虑的进步。

sentences.en: We often associate the idea of learning with bursts of inspiration and moments of intense enthusiasm.
sentences.zh: 我们常常将学习与灵感的迸发和热情高涨的时刻联系起来。

userTranslationZh.text: 我们通常将学习的念头与灵感爆发和高涨的热情相关联。但是那些时刻稍纵即逝，持续不了多久。而真正的学习则存在于我们每天平静且寻常的每一步中。关键在于坚持下去，不被快结果的压力所左右。大多数时候，我们认为学习就应该是刻苦且剧烈的，能够带来大量的去肾上腺素。在现实中，最显著的学习通常是那些需要你主动，但又不至于带来过多压力的。学习关乎找到平衡，可以让你感到平稳而 不是疯狂。

sentences.en: But these moments are fleeting, and they don't last.
sentences.zh: 但这些时刻转瞬即逝，不会持续太久。

sentences.en: True learning happens in the quiet, regular steps we take each day.
sentences.zh: 真正的学习体现在我们每天安静且有规律的行动中。

sentences.en: The key is to stay consistent without being overwhelmed by the pressure of achieving quick results.
sentences.zh: 关键在于保持一致性，不要被急于求成的压力所击垮。

sentences.en: Too often, we expect learning to come with a rush of adrenaline, believing that it should be something intense and effortful.
sentences.zh: 我们常常期望学习会伴随着肾上腺素的激增，认为学习应该是一件紧张而费力的事情。

sentences.en: In reality, the most profound learning takes place in the space between pressure and passivity.
sentences.zh: 然而，事实上，最深刻的学习往往发生在压力与被动之间的那个空间。

sentences.en: It's about finding the balance, giving yourself permission to be steady rather than frantic.
sentences.zh: 关键在于找到平衡，允许自己保持稳定，而不是急躁不安。

sentences.en: Learning is not a race but a journey—one that requires patience.
sentences.zh: 学习不是一场赛跑，而是一段需要耐心的旅程。

userTranslationZh.text: 学习不是一场竞争，更像是一场需要耐心才可以走完的旅程。做到平静学习是有技巧的。首先，设置清晰的目标是非常有必要的，你要明白你想要什么，对于那些没有必要的急事，则不需要给自己太大负担。接下来，将学习内容拆分成一个个微小且容易管理的任务。每一个小任务都必须清晰且伸伸手就可以完成，这样可以在完成时会带来满足感。还有一点至关重要，那就是将自身的专注点放在完成度而非完美度上，允许自己犯错误，并不要因为而感到愧疚。按照上述方法，循序渐进来打造一个稳固的基础。没有必要去匆匆忙忙，平静下来，一步一步来，你会有所进步的。

sentences.en: The path to calm learning is paved with methodical steps.
sentences.zh: 通往平静学习的道路是由一系列有条不紊的步骤铺就的。

sentences.en: First, it's essential to set a clear goal—know what you want to achieve, but don't burden yourself with unnecessary urgency.
sentences.zh: 首先，设定一个明确的目标至关重要——明确自己想要达成什么，但不要给自己施加不必要的紧迫感。

sentences.en: Next, break down the learning process into smaller, manageable tasks.
sentences.zh: 接下来，将学习过程分解为更小、更易管理的任务。

sentences.en: These smaller tasks should be clear and attainable, providing a sense of accomplishment with each completion.
sentences.zh: 这些小任务应明确且可实现，每次完成都能让人获得成就感。

sentences.en: It's crucial to focus on progress, not perfection, and allow yourself to make mistakes without guilt.
sentences.zh: 关键是要关注进步，而非追求完美，允许自己犯错，不要心怀愧疚。

sentences.en: As you follow the correct method, each step builds upon the last, creating a stable foundation.
sentences.zh: 当你遵循正确的方法时，每一步都基于前一步，从而奠定一个坚实的基础。

sentences.en: There's no need to rush—step by step, calmly, you will make progress.
sentences.zh: 无需急躁——一步步踏实前行，你定会取得进步。

sentences.en: To truly learn, we must first accept our current state, no matter how imperfect it may seem.
sentences.zh: 要真正学习，我们必须首先接受自己当前的状态，无论它看起来多么不完美。

userTranslationZh.text: 要想真正学到点东西，我们需要接受我们当前的状态，无论它看上去有多么不完美。我们总是急切的渴望改变，渴望进入到一下阶段。但真切的成长始于自我接受——认识到自己当前的位置以及要去的方向。这种自我觉知并不会限制我们，相反，它给予了我们充分的自由来意图清晰且明确的走好前进路上的每一步。通过接受我们目前的处境，我们就可以；冷静且高效来计划下一步，而不再需要来强迫自己。只有当我们接受了当下时刻的自己，我们才开始真正的改变。

sentences.en: We are often too eager to change, to reach the next level.
sentences.zh: 我们往往过于渴望改变，渴望达到更高的水平。

sentences.en: But true growth begins with acceptance—acknowledging where we are and where we need to go.
sentences.zh: 但真正的成长始于接受——承认我们现在的位置以及我们需要前往的方向。

sentences.en: This self-awareness doesn't limit us; instead, it frees us to take the necessary steps forward with clarity and purpose.
sentences.zh: 这种自我意识并不会限制我们，反而能让我们以清晰而坚定的态度，勇敢地迈出必要的步伐。

sentences.en: By embracing where we are, we can plan our next steps calmly and effectively, without the need to force change.
sentences.zh: 通过接纳现状，我们能够冷静而有效地规划下一步行动，无需强行改变。

sentences.en: Only by accepting the reality of our present moment can we begin to change it.
sentences.zh: 唯有接受当下的现实，我们才能着手改变。

sentences.en: Learning is not about escaping our circumstances but engaging with them.
sentences.zh: 学习并非要逃避我们所处的环境，而是要与之互动。

userTranslationZh.text: 学习不是逃避我们自身的境遇，而是要考虑他们。当我们学会了接受学习路上的挑战和不适时，我们就具备了韧性。在这个基础上，我们可以逐步塑造自己的未来。理解改变需要时间和耐心，我们就不再对及时满足抱有期待而是转向对自身稳定进步的专注。这种平静的态度确保了成长的持续和成就的意义性。基于现实设置不会压垮你的目标，并且逐步增加学习的复杂性。这样，你没有强迫去学习但也得到了进步。当我们学会了对自身节奏的掌握，我们才解锁了学习真正的潜力。

sentences.en: When we accept the challenges and discomforts of our learning journey, we develop resilience.
sentences.zh: 当我们勇于面对学习过程中的挑战和不适时，我们的韧性就会得到培养。

sentences.en: From this foundation, we can shape the future, one step at a time.
sentences.zh: 以此为基础，我们可以一步一个脚印地塑造未来。

sentences.en: Understanding that change takes time and requires patience, we stop expecting instant gratification and focus on the steady progress we make.
sentences.zh: 我们明白改变需要时间和耐心，因此不再期待即刻的满足，而是专注于我们取得的稳步进展。

sentences.en: This calm approach ensures lasting growth and meaningful achievements.
sentences.zh: 这种从容不迫的态度确保了持久的成长和有意义的成就。

sentences.en: Set realistic goals that don't overwhelm you and gradually increase the complexity of what you learn.
sentences.zh: 设定切实可行的目标，不让自己不堪重负，然后逐渐增加所学内容的复杂性。

sentences.en: This way, you can make progress without forcing it.
sentences.zh: 这样，你就能自然而然地取得进步。

sentences.en: When we learn to pace ourselves, we unlock the true potential of learning.
sentences.zh: 当我们学会掌控节奏，就能释放学习的真正潜力。

sentences.en: Learning requires the courage to endure boredom.
sentences.zh: 学习需要勇气去忍受枯燥。

userTranslationZh.text: 学习需要忍受无聊的勇气。对微小任务枯燥单调的重复练习正是真正发展专业技能的训练场地。这个过程中非常容易被伴随新颖和兴奋而来的愿景分散注意力，但正是那些平凡的时刻才是成长扎根的地方。无论是再次阅读某一章节还是练习重复的技能，关键是持之以恒。这个过程可能会偶尔感到枯燥，但掌握也正是在这个过程中建立起来的。学习真正的价值并不在于看到立即的结果，而是体现在习惯、日复一日的重复和即使得不到奖励的坚持。这种默默的坚持，才会让你走向精通。

sentences.en: The monotonous repetition of small tasks is the true training ground for developing expertise.
sentences.zh: 单调重复的小任务，才是培养专业能力的真正训练场。

sentences.en: It's easy to be distracted by the promise of novelty or excitement, but it's in the mundane that learning takes root.
sentences.zh: 人们很容易被新奇或兴奋的事物诱惑而分心，但学习恰恰是在平凡日常中扎根生长的。

sentences.en: Whether reading the same chapter again or practicing the same skill, consistency is key.
sentences.zh: 无论是反复阅读同一章节，还是不断练习同一技能，持之以恒都是关键。

sentences.en: The process may seem dull at times, but it's in this space that mastery is built.
sentences.zh: 这个过程有时或许显得乏味，但正是在这样的时光里，精通的能力才得以构建。

sentences.en: The true value of learning doesn't lie in immediate results but in the dedication to routine, to showing up every day, and continuing without expecting quick rewards.
sentences.zh: 学习的真正价值不在于立竿见影，而在于对日常规律的坚守——每天坚持投入，不期待快速回报地持续下去。

sentences.en: This quiet endurance is what ultimately leads to mastery.
sentences.zh: 这种默默的坚持，最终会带你走向精通。

sentences.en: In a powerful commencement address delivered at the University of Pennsylvania, Academy Award-winning actor Denzel Washington shared life lessons not from his successes, but from his failures.
sentences.zh: 在宾夕法尼亚大学一场充满力量的毕业典礼演讲中，奥斯卡奖得主、演员丹泽尔·华盛顿分享的人生教训并非来自他的成功，而是源于他的失败。

userTranslationZh.text: 在宾夕法尼亚大学的开学致辞中，奥斯卡获奖者丹泽尔华盛顿从他的失败而不是成功的角度出发分享了人生一课，

sentences.en: His central message, "Fall Forward," challenges the conventional wisdom of playing it safe and encourages us to embrace risk as a necessary step toward greatness.
sentences.zh: 他传达的核心信息——“向前跌倒”——挑战了“求稳为上”的传统智慧，鼓励我们将冒险视为通往卓越的必要步骤。

userTranslationZh.text: 他传达的核心信息“向前倒”鼓励我们接受风险，并将其视为迈向伟大必不可少的一步，这无疑是挑战了“小心推进”的传统智慧。

sentences.en: The Concept of "Falling Forward"
sentences.zh: “向前跌倒”的理念

sentences.en: Washington critiques the common advice to "have something to fall back on.
sentences.zh: 华盛顿批评了常见的“留条后路”建议。

sentences.en: " He argues that preparing for failure with a safety net only prepares you to quit.
sentences.zh: 他认为，用安全网为失败做准备，只会让你准备放弃。

sentences.en: Instead, he urges us to **"Fall Forward"**—meaning that if you fail, you should fail while reaching for something.
sentences.zh: 相反，他敦促我们 **“向前跌倒”**——这意味着即使失败，也应在奋力争取时失败。

sentences.en: By falling forward, you can at least see what you are about to hit.
sentences.zh: 通过向前跌倒，你至少能看清自己将撞上什么。

sentences.en: This mindset shifts the perspective of failure from a dead end to a part of the forward momentum.
sentences.zh: 这种心态将失败的视角从死胡同转变为前进动力的一部分。

sentences.en: Failure is Inevitable and Necessary
sentences.zh: 失败是不可避免且必要的

sentences.en: The speech emphasizes that if you are not failing, you are likely not trying hard enough.
sentences.zh: 演讲强调，如果你没有失败，很可能是因为你不够努力。

sentences.en: Washington cites historical examples to illustrate that failure is often a precursor to legendary success:
sentences.zh: 华盛顿引用历史案例说明失败往往是传奇成功的先导：

sentences.en: * **Reggie Jackson** struck out 2,600 times—the most in baseball history—but he is remembered for his home runs, not his strikeouts.
sentences.zh: * **雷吉·杰克逊** 曾三振出局2600次——棒球史上最多——但人们记住的是他的本垒打，而非三振。

sentences.en: * **Thomas Edison** conducted 1,000 failed experiments before inventing the light bulb.
sentences.zh: * **托马斯·爱迪生** 进行了1000次失败实验后才发明了电灯泡。

sentences.en: As Washington notes, "The 1,001st was the light bulb.
sentences.zh: 正如华盛顿所言：“第1001次实验带来了电灯。

sentences.en: Dreams Without Goals Are Just Dreams
sentences.zh: 没有目标的梦想只是空想

sentences.en: While imagination is crucial, Washington distinguishes between **dreams** and **goals**.
sentences.zh: 尽管想象力至关重要，华盛顿区分了 **梦想** 与 **目标**。

sentences.en: He warns that dreams without goals—and without the discipline and consistency to achieve them—eventually fuel disappointment.
sentences.zh: 他警告说，没有目标的梦想——以及缺乏实现梦想的纪律和坚持——终将滋生失望。

sentences.en: He advises setting specific goals: life goals, yearly goals, monthly goals, and daily goals.
sentences.zh: 他建议设定具体目标：人生目标、年度目标、月度目标和每日目标。

sentences.en: Consistency is the vehicle that turns dreams into reality.
sentences.zh: 持之以恒是将梦想变为现实的载体。

sentences.en: Do Not Be Afraid to Go Outside the Box
sentences.zh: 勇于突破思维定式

sentences.en: Using the analogy of the famous "nine dots" puzzle, Washington reminds us that often the only way to solve a problem is to go outside the imaginary boundaries we set for ourselves.
sentences.zh: 借用著名的“九点谜题”作类比，华盛顿提醒我们，解决问题的唯一方法往往是突破自我设定的想象边界。

sentences.en: Success requires taking risks and venturing into the unknown.
sentences.zh: 成功需要冒险并探索未知领域。

sentences.en: He shares his own vulnerability, recounting a time he auditioned for a Broadway musical and failed miserably because he couldn't sing.
sentences.zh: 他坦露自身脆弱经历，回忆曾试镜百老汇音乐剧却因不会唱歌而惨败。

sentences.en: Years later, he returned to that exact same theater to star in the play *Fences*, winning a Tony Award.
sentences.zh: 多年后，他重返同一剧院主演《藩篱》，并赢得托尼奖。

sentences.en: The lesson: **"You hang around the barbershop long enough, sooner or later you're going to get a haircut.
sentences.zh: 其启示在于：**“在理发店待得够久，迟早会剪上头。

sentences.en: "** Persistence pays off.
sentences.zh: ”** 坚持终有回报。

sentences.en: Use Your Gifts to Help Others
sentences.zh: 用天赋帮助他人

sentences.en: Washington concludes by reminding us that our value is not determined by what we have, but by what we do with what we have.
sentences.zh: 华盛顿最后提醒我们，人的价值不由拥有什么决定，而取决于如何运用已有之物。

sentences.en: Whether one’s talent is in medicine, business, or the arts, the true measure of success is how those talents are used to aid others.
sentences.zh: 无论一个人的天赋在于医学、商业还是艺术，成功的真正尺度在于如何运用这些才能帮助他人。

sentences.en: He leaves the audience with a Japanese proverb that perfectly encapsulates the spirit of resilience: **"Fall down seven times, get up eight.
sentences.zh: 他以一句日本谚语作结，完美诠释了坚韧精神：**“七次跌倒，八次起身。

sentences.en: Many people derive less satisfaction from each additional dollar gained, making potential losses hurt more than equivalent gains feel good.
sentences.zh: 许多人从每额外获得的一美元中得到的满足感递减，使得潜在损失带来的痛苦远大于等额收益带来的愉悦。

sentences.en: because they value the certainty of the $50 more than the possibility of getting $100 balanced by the possibility of getting nothing.
sentences.zh: 因为他们更看重50美元的确定性，而非可能获得100美元但也可能一无所获的风险。

sentences.en: The core principle is to group data points such that items within the same cluster exhibit higher similarity to each other than to items belonging to different clusters.
sentences.zh: 核心原则是将数据点分组，使得同一聚类内的项目彼此相似度高于与其他聚类项目的相似度。

sentences.en: The light for Fisher comes from what initially appears to be a bizarre decision on the part of this absent-minded academic with a tendency to neglect practical details
sentences.zh: 费舍尔的灵感源于这位心不在焉、常忽略实际细节的学者最初看似古怪的决定。

sentences.en: He had been summoned to the imperial court in Chang'an by Emperor Xuanzong, initially filled with high hopes for a political career where he could use his talents to serve the country.
sentences.zh: 他曾应唐玄宗征召入长安宫廷，最初满怀从政抱负，希望施展才华报效国家。

sentences.en: However, he faced political intrigue, slander from powerful court officials (like Gao Lishi and Yang Guozhong), and found that the emperor primarily valued him for his poetic talent rather than his political advice. His ambitions were thwarted.
sentences.zh: 然而他遭遇政治阴谋与权臣（如高力士、杨国忠）诽谤，发现皇帝主要赏识其诗才而非政见，抱负终未得施展。

sentences.en: There will come a time to ride the wind and cleave the waves; Straight hoist cloud-like sails to cross the vast ocean
sentences.zh: 长风破浪会有时，直挂云帆济沧海。

sentences.en: Keep experimenting, and remember that RL is as much art as science
sentences.zh: 持续实验，要记住强化学习既是科学也是艺术。

sentences.en: This page contains tutorials which are not maintained by Farama Foundation and, as such, cannot be guaranteed to function as intended.
sentences.zh: 本页面包含非 Farama 基金会维护的教程，因此无法保证其功能符合预期。

sentences.en: This is the most significant logical hurdle.
sentences.zh: 这是最关键的逻辑障碍。

sentences.en: To function in a complex environment, the agent theoretically needs to have encountered a representative sample of these states.
sentences.zh: 为在复杂环境中运作，智能体理论上需要接触过这些状态的典型样本。

sentences.en: Using it as an adjective to describe how one walks ("walking with clear intent") is slightly awkward in Chinese phrasing.
sentences.zh: 将其用作形容步态的形容词（"目标明确地行走"）在中文表达中略显生硬。

sentences.en: Your intuition is a functional definition of General Intelligence (adapting to an environment via math), but it is an aspirational definition of current Deep Learning.
sentences.zh: 你的直觉是对通用智能的功能性定义（通过数学适应环境），但这却是当前深度学习的理想化定义。

sentences.en: If you embed the image in a Notion page (as you seem to be doing based on the context), only people with access to that Notion page can see it.
sentences.zh: 若将图片嵌入 Notion 页面（根据上下文推测你正在操作），则仅拥有该页面访问权限者可见。

sentences.en: These semantic features are then concatenated with global visual features, creating a much richer representation that's more comparable to natural language.
sentences.zh: 这些语义特征随后与全局视觉特征拼接，形成更丰富、更接近自然语言的表征形式。

sentences.en: The days of manually scrubbing through footage may be numbered
sentences.zh: 人工筛查影像资料的时代或许即将终结。

sentences.en: This naturally inflates the "Query" count to be significantly higher than the "Moment" count.
sentences.zh: 这自然导致"查询"次数显著高于"片段"数量。

sentences.en: The toy was originally designed to have a cheerful smile. However, a worker at the factory accidentally sewed the mouth upside down, giving the horse a distinctively sad, pouting expression
sentences.zh: 该玩具原设计带着欢快笑容，但工厂工人误将嘴巴缝反，使小马呈现出独特的悲伤嘟嘴表情。

sentences.en: The "crying horse" became a viral phenomenon in China in January 2026, just ahead of the Lunar New Year
sentences.zh: 2026年1月农历新年前夕，"哭泣小马"在中国成为网络爆红现象。

sentences.en: The plush toys are produced by a shop named "Happy Sister" in the Yiwu International Trade City (China’s famous wholesale market).
sentences.zh: 这款毛绒玩具产自义乌国际商贸城（中国著名批发市场）内名为"快乐姐姐"的店铺。

sentences.en: The shop owner, Zhang Huoqing, initially offered a refund to the customer who received the "defective" horse. However, the customer kept it, and photos of the sad horse circulated online
sentences.zh: 店主章火青起初向收到"瑕疵品"的顾客提出退款，但顾客选择保留，悲伤小马的照片随之在网络流传。

sentences.en: Netizens dubbed it the "Crying Horse" (or "Cry-Cry Horse") and found it incredibly relatable. It became a symbol for exhausted office workers, with many joking that the "smiling horse is you after work" while the "crying horse is you at work."
sentences.zh: 网友称其为"哭哭马"并深感共鸣，它成为疲惫上班族的象征，许多人戏称"微笑马是下班后的你，哭泣马是工作中的你"。

userTranslationZh.text: 许多网民戏称其为哭哭马并与其产生了强烈的共鸣。哭哭马也变为了精疲力竭职员的象征，有许多人调侃道：“笑笑马是结束工作后的你，哭哭马则是正在工作的你。”

sentences.en: She became famous for posting relatable videos about the awkwardness of making small talk in elevators
sentences.zh: 她因发布关于电梯内尴尬寒暄的 relatable 短视频而走红。

sentences.en: The monotonous repetition of small tasks is the true training ground for developing expertise.
sentences.zh: 单调重复的琐碎任务正是培养专业能力的真实训练场。

sentences.zh: 但这会触发所有 Bash 调用（包括自动批准的）。目前 Claude Code 钩子尚无内置方法区分"需授权"与"自动批准"场景——PreToolUse 钩子总会触发。

sentences.zh: 保存偏好设置但暂不改变任何行为（留待后续实现）。

sentences.en: ### Global R&D Shift: China Takes the Top Spot
sentences.zh: 全球研发格局变迁：中国首次登顶

sentences.en: For the first time in history, China has surpassed the United States to become the world’s leading spender on research and development.
sentences.zh: 历史上首次，中国超越美国成为全球研发支出第一大国。

sentences.en: In 2024, China invested $785.9 billion in R&D, capturing a 27.4% share of the global total.
sentences.zh: 2024年中国研发投入达7859亿美元，占全球总额的27.4%。

sentences.en: This milestone marks a significant shift in the scientific balance of power, as the U.S. moves to second place with $781.8 billion (27.2%).
sentences.zh: 这一里程碑标志着科学力量平衡的重大转变，美国以7818亿美元（27.2%）的投入退居第二。

sentences.en: ### Divergent Strategies
sentences.zh: 战略路径分化

sentences.en: While both nations dominate the landscape—controlling a combined 54.7% of global R&D—their investment engines differ fundamentally.
sentences.zh: 尽管中美两国共同占据全球研发总支出的54.7%，但其投入机制存在本质差异。

sentences.en: China’s surge is propelled by a centralized model, where government laboratories channel funding into national strategic priorities like energy and biotechnology.
sentences.zh: 中国的迅猛增长由集中化模式驱动，政府实验室将资金导向能源、生物技术等国家战略重点领域。

sentences.en: In contrast, American R&D remains heavily reliant on the private sector, driven by corporate giants such as Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta.
sentences.zh: 相比之下，美国研发仍高度依赖私营部门，主要由亚马逊、字母表和元平台等企业巨头推动。

sentences.en: ### The Rise of Asia
sentences.zh: 亚洲研发崛起

sentences.en: The data highlights a broader geopolitical pivot toward Asia, which now accounts for 45% of all global R&D activity.
sentences.zh: 数据凸显了全球研发活动向亚洲倾斜的宏观趋势，该地区现已占据全球研发总量的45%。

sentences.en: While Japan remains the third-largest spender at $186.0 billion, its share of the global pie has seen a sharp decline since 2000.
sentences.zh: 日本虽以1860亿美元保持第三大研发支出国地位，但其全球份额自2000年以来已大幅萎缩。

sentences.en: Meanwhile, South Korea and India are accelerating their presence, pushing the region to the forefront of innovation.
sentences.zh: 与此同时，韩国和印度正加速提升研发实力，推动该地区站上创新前沿。

sentences.en: ### Europe’s Changing Position
sentences.zh: 欧洲地位演变

sentences.en: European heavyweights Germany, the UK, and France maintain positions within the top 10, yet they face a shrinking share of the global market.
sentences.zh: 欧洲主要国家德国、英国和法国仍保持全球前十地位，但其全球市场份额持续收缩。

sentences.en: However, there are sectors of resilience: European corporate investment in healthcare and energy saw double-digit growth in 2024, outpacing competitors in both the U.S. and Asia.
sentences.zh: 不过部分领域展现出韧性：2024年欧洲企业在医疗健康和能源领域的投资实现两位数增长，增速超越美国 and 亚洲的竞争对手。
